腏字的基本解释

腏
zhuì
古同“餟”，连续祭：“其下四方地，为腏，食群神从者及北斗云。”

腏字的汉语字典释义
暂无汉字(腏)的汉语大字典的解释
腏字的康熙字典解释

【未集下】【肉字部】　腏； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页987第03
【唐韻】陟劣切，音輟。【說文】挑取骨閒肉也。【廣韻】骨閒髓也。　又【廣韻】丁活切，音掇。又【集韻】旋芮切，音彗。義?同。　又【廣韻】陟衞切【集韻】株衞切，?音綴。祭酹也。　本作餟。亦柞醊。

腏字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
腏字的起名意思

暂无。

Elixirs
Basic explanation of words
Elixirs
zhuì
Ancient Tong "Ying", continuous sacrifice: "The four places under it are the elixirs, the followers of the gods of the food group, and the Big Dipper cloud."

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Not set next] [Meat word department] 　腏; Kangxi strokes: 14; Page number: Page 987 03
[Tang Yun] Zhi is inferior, and the sound is broken. [Said the text] Pick the bones and free meat. [Guang Yun] The bones are also free.　[Guang Yun] Ding is lively and sound. [Jiyun] Xuan Ruiqie, Yinhui. Righteous? Same.　[Guangyun] Zhi Weiqie [Jiyun] Zhu Weiqie,? Sound embellishment. Sacrifice also.　This is a 餟. Yi 柞醊.
